decision_conditions: The Commercial Sale use as well as all associated fixtures and structures (including the Car Cleaning Facility) hereby permitted shall be discontinued and all fixtures, structures and fittings associated with the use shall be removed within 24 months of the date of this planning permission and the land returned to its previous lawful use. The area where the development/use is located shall be restored to a space of at least equivalent quality as the pre-existing space.
REASON

The use and associated building are not considered suitable for permanent retention in compliance with paras 152-154 of the NPPF (2023), Policy DMHB11 and DMEI 4 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020)
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers:
and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).
The temporary Commercial Car Sales use shall only operate within the southern car park area as identified in purple within drawing 233L-(20)-200 Rev P3.
REASON

To ensure sufficient car park and ancillary outdoor space is maintained to service the existing lawful F1/F2 in accordance with Policies DMCI 1 & DMT 6 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020) and Policies S1, T4 and T6 of the London Plan (2021).
The commercial car sales use shall not be used except between the following hours:
1000 and 1900, Mondays - Saturdays
1100 to 1600 Sundays, Public or Bank Holidays
REASON: To safeguard the residential amenity of the occupiers of adjoining and nearby properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020)

Notwithstanding the hereby approved plans, a minimum of 3 No of Trees shall be planted within the area as identified in green within drawing 233L-(20)-200 Rev P3. The trees shall be native species and shall be planted within the first available planting season from the date of the decision notice.

The new planting and landscape operations should comply with the requirements specified in BS 3936 (1992) 'Nursery Stock, Part 1, Specification for Trees and Shrubs' and in BS 4428 (1989) 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations (Excluding Hard Surfaces)'.

Thereafter, areas of planting shall be permanently retained and any trees or other planting which die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased within a period of 5 years from the completion of development, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species in accordance with the details approved by the Local Planning Authority.
